content.question:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A survey conducted by a national research center in 2018 asked a random sample of people over age 12 years old in the United States whether it is very important to them personally to have a lot of money. Responses are summarized based on age in the following table of counts.

Adults
Teenagers

Very important
<math alttext="281" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>281</mn></math>
<math alttext="86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>86</mn></math>

Not very important
<math alttext="180" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>180</mn></math>
<math alttext="168" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>168</mn></math>

Total
<math alttext="461" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>461</mn></math>
<math alttext="254" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>254</mn></math>

(a) Construct a graph to compare the responses of adults and teenagers.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A survey conducted by a national research center in 2018 asked a random sample of people over age 12 years old in the United States whether it is very important to them personally to have a lot of money. Responses are summarized based on age in the following table of counts.

Adults
Teenagers

Very important
<math alttext="281" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>281</mn></math>
<math alttext="86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>86</mn></math>

Not very important
<math alttext="180" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>180</mn></math>
<math alttext="168" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>168</mn></math>

Total
<math alttext="461" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>461</mn></math>
<math alttext="254" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>254</mn></math>

(a) Construct a graph to compare the responses of adults and teenagers.

(b) A hypothesis test will be conducted to investigate whether the proportion of all United States adults who would respond that it is very important to have a lot of money is different from the proportion of all United States teenagers who would respond that it is very important to have a lot of money. Identify the appropriate test and state the hypotheses.

(c) The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of the hypothesis test was found to be less than <math alttext="0.0001" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0001</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value, what is the appropriate conclusion for the test? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.4: Representing a Categorical Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
